definition: half of the day/a long time/quite a while
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
erhua variant of 前半晌[qian2 ban4 shang3]

sentences.english: Lester ruminated for a while, toying with his fork.
sentences.chinese: 雷斯脫手裏拿一把叉玩弄着沉吟了半晌。

sentences.english: Itchy nose waist sour, rain in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 腰痠瘡疤癢，有雨在半晌。

sentences.english: The bartender can't believe his ears, and remains silent.
sentences.chinese: 調酒師不敢相信自己的耳朵，沉默了半晌。

sentences.english: About the middle of the morning, I was asked to go to the principal's office.
sentences.chinese: 上午過了半晌，我給叫到校長室去。

sentences.english: For a while Atzel shook his head, pondering.
sentences.chinese: 半晌，阿採兒搖搖頭，陷入沉思中。

sentences.english: Mother was stunned for a while and put it on the kitchen table.
sentences.chinese: 母親呆呆地半晌才接過來，放在飯桌上。

sentences.english: He finished the bottle of wine in a shake.
sentences.chinese: 他半晌功夫就把一瓶酒喝完了。

sentences.english: It took him quite a while to recall who I was.
sentences.chinese: 他想了半晌纔想起我是誰。

sentences.english: They were scrambling up the mountainside in the late afternoon heat.
sentences.chinese: 在下午後半晌的炎熱中，他們向山坡上爬赴。

sentences.english: After flying a long while, the witch saw them.
sentences.chinese: 經過飛了半晌，巫婆看見了他們。

definition: half the day/a long time/quite a while
to have heard what was said
half of the day/a long time/quite a while/midair/CL:個|个[ge4]
